title: Sherif1258
author: Sherif1258
created_time: June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AMLast edit: June 15, 2023, 09:28:01 AM by Sherif1258
content: in short1- freebitco.in banned all egypt ip addresses ranges from earning (can not click 'ROLL' l, can not click 'withdraw')2- only VPN works with them but not guaranteed, freebitco.in banning them when reach the minimum amount and click withdraw3- so, all egyptians people must stop visiting this website4- its global site rank became 1854 (decreased 41 sites yesterday)5- if no one from egypt visit this website; its global site rank will continue decreasing until down away and lose people's trust6- because they must know that it is a losing website, not earning websiteevery one not believe me, will believe me in the future, after he/she lose all their own money

comments.author: taufik123
comments.body: Try to include the source of the news so that there is an original reference to the news you provide. Because as far as I know, Egypt has banned Bitcoin or crypto-related transactions for a long time and not just this time, especially on the freebitco.in site..Quote"Egypt's Dar al-Ifta, the primary Islamic legislator in Egypt, has issued a religious decree classifying commercial transactions in bitcoin as haram (prohibited under Islamic law)."https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legality_of_cryptocurrency_by_country_or_territoryThe freebitco.in site is still quite safe for me in Asia and is still running quite smoothly. The global site ranking is only influenced by visitors from Egypt? it should cover all data for freebitco.in site visitors around the world. If it is said to be a loss-making website, why does this site still stand strong until now and not disappear from the internet? When I first started doing RoLL I made quite a lot from the site, even though it was only a little and it was free.

comments.author: Wapfika
comments.body: Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AMin short1- freebitco.in banned all egypt ip addresses ranges from earning (can not click 'ROLL' l, can not click 'withdraw')2- only VPN works with them but not guaranteed, freebitco.in banning them when reach the minimum amount and click withdraw3- so, all egyptians people must stop visiting this websiteStop this negative attack on Freebitco.in because the problem is with your country's regulations for online casinos. Egypt is an Islam country which strictly prohibits gambling. I'm using freebitco.in since it's still a faucet and a hi-lo game website. This restriction is the same with other casinos if you will try to browse them too.Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AM4- its global site rank became 1854 (decreased 41 sites yesterday)5- if no one from egypt visit this website; its global site rank will continue decreasing until down away and lose people's trust6- because they must know that it is a losing website, not earning websiteI'm wondering will Egyptians contribute to the majority of visits to the casino while its strictly prohibited by your religion and country?

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AM1- freebitco.in banned all egypt ip addresses ranges from earning (can not click 'ROLL' l, can not click 'withdraw')2- only VPN works with them but not guaranteed, freebitco.in banning them when reach the minimum amount and click withdraw3- so, all egyptians people must stop visiting this websiteIf you're interested in bitcoin and still falls under centralized authorities you're wrong, bitcoin should be in our possession through a decentralized means to store them, if you're part of the lucky ones to engage the use of VPN to move your asset then you're lucky as long as it's not stucked down with them.Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AM4- its global site rank became 1854 (decreased 41 sites yesterday)5- if no one from egypt visit this website; its global site rank will continue decreasing until down away and lose people's trustIt's obvious that everyone may not leave at the same time but a large number will definitely leave them, some investors or users may play ignorance, unaware, or don't care about any preceding consequence.Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AM6- because they must know that it is a losing website, not earning websiteMaybe we shouldn't focus on freebitco.in alone but all other centralized means of holding up our bitcoin, as long as our bitcoin are in custody of these centralized institutions, it all belongs to them and we may just be lucky to have little access to posses some provided we took them off before any issues arises.Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AMevery one not believe me, will believe me in the future, after he/she lose all their own moneyPeople may not actually believed this because there's nothing provided by you to serve as evidence or prove what you've just mentioned, but the only thing i see about this is the aspect of not your keys not your coins, only if some will quicken their steps to evade their asset off them before it's completely hooked down.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AM1- freebitco.in banned all egypt ip addresses ranges from earning (can not click 'ROLL' l, can not click 'withdraw')2- only VPN works with them but not guaranteed, freebitco.in banning them when reach the minimum amount and click withdrawAre you sure that you have not done anything that is not allowed by the rules of this site? More than one account and claim bonuses from all of them, for example?Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AM4- its global site rank became 1854 (decreased 41 sites yesterday)5- if no one from egypt visit this website; its global site rank will continue decreasing until down away and lose people's trust1854 or 1813 totally negligible difference, even if it is measured in tens of thousands, not just 41. It is a rather complex metric and drawing any conclusions based on it (certainly not what you are doing) is absolutely frivolous.Maybe you are angry and want them to stop their business, but what you are saying has nothing to do with the real state of affairs. Quote from: 348Judah on June 15, 2023, 11:40:45 AMIt's obvious that everyone may not leave at the same time but a large number will definitely leave them, some investors or users may play ignorance, unaware, or don't care about any preceding consequence.How did you conclude that a large number of users will leave them? Because of this topic that Sherif1258 opened or do you have some additional insider knowledge?

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 09:12:02 AMin short1- freebitco.in banned all egypt ip addresses ranges from earning (can not click 'ROLL' l, can not click 'withdraw')2- only VPN works with them but not guaranteed, freebitco.in banning them when reach the minimum amount and click withdraw3- so, all egyptians people must stop visiting this website4- its global site rank became 1854 (decreased 41 sites yesterday)5- if no one from egypt visit this website; its global site rank will continue decreasing until down away and lose people's trust6- because they must know that it is a losing website, not earning websiteevery one not believe me, will believe me in the future, after he/she lose all their own moneyI do not know if Egypt is excluded from the freebitco allowed countries, but one thing is sure that even if they restrict the Egyptians from accessing this site on any legal reasons, it won't have much impact on their business and ranking. The freebitco site is being used globally and people from all around the world access this site.Also, if they have restricted the egypt ip addresses, it is advised not to use VPN to access the site. Because if they caught you using VPN, they will close your account and you will lose all your funds. I feel sorry for you but its time you move on to some another gambling site which is allowed in your country.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Freebitco.in already established its presence and reputation in the industry for many years I doubt if a country that banned trading Cryptocurrency will have an impact if they choose to not support Freebitco.in anymore most of their user base comes from countries where Cryptocurrency is openly adopted and not from a country that bans Cryptocurrency, it will not make a big impact, they are still offering a lot of big prizes and their token is still doing good in the market.

comments.author: UmerIdrees
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on June 15, 2023, 01:36:14 PMFreebitco.in already established its presence and reputation in the industry for many years I doubt if a country that banned trading Cryptocurrency will have an impact if they choose to not support Freebitco.in anymore most of their user base comes from countries where Cryptocurrency is openly adopted and not from a country that bans Cryptocurrency, it will not make a big impact, they are still offering a lot of big prizes and their token is still doing good in the market.After reading the OP post, I decided to look at whether Freebitco has a lot of user base in Egypt and if this ban will really hurt them ? As per my initial analysis from SimilarWeb, Freebitco has a 26% user audience from Russia. And if Egypt does not fall in the top 5 countries for freebitco.This means that there is be almost zero effect if the site is banned in Egypt, except for the few users who were playing at freebitco, they would be affected of course.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: This is a FUD against Freebitco.in there's no reputable source to back up their claims platforms can ban countries because of the strict regulation and Freebitco.in being one of the reputable faucet and gambling platforms that has built their presence in the industry cannot be taken down by this kind of FUD.The Egyptians are wiser they will not just believe in this kind of FUD, and Freebitco.in don't just rely on one country to sustain their platform, they are popular in many countries like Russia, the US, India, the Philippines, countries where casinos and faucets are popular.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: Sherif1258 on June 15, 2023, 04:46:34 PMmister, simply the website is loading but i can not click ROLL button, until last week i was click and the hour counter run, but now nothing happen when i click ROLLWhich kind of IP are you using while browsing the site? I have barely visited freebitco in the last few months but still, it says I can't click now, it's because someone else is using freebitco from my IP too because I'm using shared IP. They are here for a long time, I doubt they would simply restrict you just because you have reached the minimum amount to withdraw. That's not how a site can exist all these years. They are quite popular in the industry. Make sure you aren't doing anything wrong from your part.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Can you show proff that Freebitco.in banned Egyptian IP's other than ''trust me, bro''? From information that you provided it looks that they simply banned your account for abuse. You even admitted in your post that you was breaking their rules by using VPN to claim from faucet - it's not allowed.Also, it's possible that Egypt government banned Freebitco.in because of regulations, if I'm not mistaken, gambling isn't allowed there.It would be best to post issues related with website on official thread if you're seeking for help. @TheQuin, can you say something about OP's case?

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Freebitco.in is a good website. For whatever reason you can't access the website, I am pretty sure it is not their fault. If what you said is true, (freebitco.in banned Egypt completely) then you shouldn't tell the Egyptians not to visit the website anyway. If I remember correctly you can play on that with website while using a VPN and it is not a reason for a ban. People that have good income there will find a way to collect their earnings. Why would you want the Egyptian people to lose their earnings? That's not a good advice. Some people have hundreds of active refs there... Do you think they will abandon their business just because you said so?

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I cannot seem to find the terms and conditions of Freebitco.in, but I have a strong suspicion that your country might be one of the blacklisted countries of the platform. That means residents of Egypt are prohibited from using the services of Freebitco.in. In the first place, your country declared Bitcoin transactions as haram, so I won't be surprised if Bitcoin-supporting gambling platforms won't be accommodating Egypt residents. Secondly, are you even allowed to gamble in online casinos?

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: ^^I don't think this is the cause of the problem.If a country restricts access to a certain website or if a website bans a certain country then residents of that country shouldn't be able to access the website at all. This is not the case here, since OP already stated that he can access the website and log in to his account. He just can't click the roll button or withdraw his winnings.The problem is on the user's end or something is wrong with his account on freebitco.in (like being under investigation).

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: You must get your facts right, they are not dependent on one country for their traffic and revenues they ban Egypt because of the country's regulations and not because of anything you must have hated Freebitco.in to post something like this when you hate something you post anything without any evidence to back it up.All your opinions are wrong all websites' traffic goes up and down and in the case of freebitco.in their rank is still high, and their Funtoken is doing good in the market, my advice is to stop gambling you must have lost money on Freebitco.in that is why you have this hate post.
